courses.subject: OBSC
courses.title: Maternal and Infant Nutrition
courses.description: The course enhances and consolidates our students' knowledge on maternal and infant nutrition. In addition, it updates and broadens the visions of student on current feeding strategies from newborns to infants up to first year of life.It includes:1. Global politics and national recommendations for maternal nutrition and infant feeding; 2. Cultural and epigenetic influence on maternal diet;3. Nutrition assessment ,requirement and concerns during pregnancy and lactation;4. WHO directions on Breast-feeding and local policies on sustaining breast-feeding;5. Assessment, diagnosis and solving breast-feeding problems;6. Pathological and congenital conditions affecting nutrition and feeding;7. Special nutrition needs in preterm neonate;8. Infant nutritional requirement and oral care during first year of life.Assessment : Written Examination
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
1. understand global and national recommendations for maternal nutrition and infant feeding
2 assess maternal nutritional requirement and give advice to mothers
3. understand special nutritive and nurturing behaviour in the childbearing and infant period
4. recognise pathological and congenital conditions affecting nutrition and feeding
5. manage feeding problems
6. explore special nutritional needs in preterm neonate
7. facilitate mother to introduce new food to their infant

courses.subject: OBSC
courses.title: Clinical Leadership in Midwifery
courses.description: This course enhances the ability and performance of students who are responsible to take up the clinical leadership role in the profession.It includes:1. Relationship between professional autonomy and status;2. Theories and concepts about leadership, leadership styles, empowerment and the relationship between the sexes, leadership and empowerment;3. Future directions in midwifery;4. Changing dynamics of HK Midwifery profession;5. Workforce planning;6. Quality and safety management;7. Roles of consultant midwife;8. Roles of Hong Kong midwives from different health care setting: HA and private sectors;9. Developing clinical competency;10. Managing complaints;11. Face the media;12. Medico-legal issues in midwifery.Assessment: assignment of related topic at around 3000 words
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected tobe able to initiate leadership role in the profession. It includes:
1. Identifying relationship between professional autonomy and status
2. Understanding theories and concepts about leadership, leadership styles, empowerment and the relationship between the sexes, leadership and empowerment
3. Developing strategy to develop high standard of professional midwifery care in one's own working environment
4. Being confident and competent in handling difficult situations such as complaints and facing media

courses.subject: OBSC
courses.title: Advanced Midwifery Practice Series
courses.description: This course enhances the ability of students in understanding and handling advanced technology used in obstetrics. It includes:1. Physics and safety of ultrasound scanning in obstetrics;2. Normal and common abnormal ultrasound features;3. Interpretation and management of electronic fetal monitoring;4. Most updated methods and clinical applications of fetal surveillance;5. Relevant anatomy and physiology of the female reproductive organs;6. Role of a smear taker in cervical screening;7. Managing abnormal cervical cytology and colposcopy.8. Critical Care in Obstetrics9. Clinical Pharmacology in ObstetricsAssessment: Written examination and clinical attachment
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to be able to:
1. identify relevant anatomy and physiology of the female reproductive organs
2. understand the role of a smear taker in cervical screening
3. understand investigations, management and treatments of common cervical and pelvic abnormalities
4. understand methods and the most updated clinical applications of fetal surveillance
5. interprete fetal heart tracing with appropriate management
6. have a basic understanding of the physics and safety of ultrasound scanning in obstetrics
7. have a good master of knowledge on interpreting normal and common abnormal ultrasound findings
8. have a basic understanding of Critical Care in Obstetrics
9. develop a basic appreciation of important pharmacological terms, systems of classification of drugs
10. understand approaches used in therapeutic drug monitoring

courses.subject: OBSC
courses.title: Research Methodology
courses.description: This course advances students understanding of research concepts, design,statistics and implementation. It includes:1. Research methodology;2. Statistical concepts;3. Legal and ethical issues in research.Assessment: Research proposal for project dissertation not less than 3000 words
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Obstetric and Midwifery Care and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to be able to:
1. understand basic concepts of research and its methodologies
2. identify the components of a literature review process
3. identify the types of research methods best suited for investigating different types of problems and questions
4. develop research questions that based on and build upon a critical appraisal of existing research
5. understand basic statistical concepts
6. design a research proposal
7. be aware of the ethical principles of research, ethical challenges and approval process

courses.feedback_evaluation: Collection by paper evaluation form at last lesson.

courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lessons.

courses.subject: OBSC
courses.title: Project and Dissertation
courses.description: The course is to facilitate students to demonstrate competency in understanding of research methodology and basic statistical analysis by choosing one of the following as their dissertationsOption 1: submitting a critical appraisal of a published obstetrics or midwifery research paper including literature review, methodology used, presentation of results and implications of the study with appropriate referencing , with around 7000 words.Option 2: Given research topic, methodology and data materials, to submit a dissertation which should include literature review, rationale and explanation of the methodology used, analysis of results and systematic discussion of the implications of the study with appropriate referencing, with around 7000 words.Option 3 : Submitting a project of a standard worthy of publication in a peer-review journal, The dissertation should be around 7000 words and include literature review, rationale and explanation of the methodology used, presentation of results and systematic discussion of the implications of the study with appropriate referencing.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to demonstrate competency in understanding of research methodology and basic statiscal analysis by understaking a supervised research project on midwifery care.

courses.subject: OBSC
courses.title: Teaching and Learning in Midwifery Education
courses.description: The course includes 2 parts: (1) Teaching and Learning (2) Public Health Education This course enhances the competencies of midwives in teaching or mentoring role. Students will learn how to design a curriculum and improve teaching skills by demonstrating a classroom teaching. By addressing social and cultural behaviours, students can identify maternal health problems and learn how to conduct health promotion programmes. Assessment: Presentation of a knowledge transfer topic which is selected by student herself/ Submission of a midwifery program proposal
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Obstetric and Midwifery Care
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to be able to:
1. draft a curriculum
2. plan and develop programs
3. critically appraise OR compare various teaching and learning strategies use in classroom and clinical settings
4. assess learning
5. use technologies to assess, plan, implement and evaluate learning
6. apply educational psychology in teaching and learning process
7. identify maternal health problems
8. conduct health promotion programmes.
courses.course_syllabus:
Web-based teaching and learning
Design and production of audio-visual materials
Become a teacher, from novice to expert
Use of database/electronic resourses available in CUHK library
Strategies to facilitate a competenc-based teaching and learning
How to impress audience by your lecture
Adult learning principles
Teaching and learning strategies in classroom and clinical teaching
Principles of assessment
Assessing strategies and learning outcomes
Construction OSCE
Construction of MCQs
Construction of SAQ and essay questions
Reflective jounrals, group projects and assessment
Case study and assessment

courses.subject: OBSC
courses.title: Reproductive medicine and Assisted Reproductive Technology
courses.description: The course is to broaden student knowledge on reproductive problems and assisted reproductive technology. It includes:1. Investigation of infertility;2. Ovulation induction;3. Assisted reproductive technology;4. Complications of ART;5. Counseling of infertile complex.Assessment: Written Examination
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Obstetric and Midwifery Care and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes:
The students are expected to:
1. have a basic understanding of reproductive problems and current technology development
2. be able to understand the strategy in counselling infertile couple
3. provide counseling of infertile complex
a. Investigation of infertility
b. Ovulation induction
c. Assisted reproductive technology
d. Complications of ART

courses.subject: OBSC
courses.title: Professional Midwifery Practice Series
courses.description: These 2 series are the contemporary issues that within the midwifery spectrum of care. Students are expected to synthesize the experience and knowledge of these areas and develop in-depth understanding of their own profession.(1) Promoting normal birth Part 1 will enhance students’ confidence and ability in providing midwifery care in a low technology setting without compromising maternal and fetal well-being. (2) Maternal health and well- being in the perinatal period Part 2 will update students’ knowledge in understanding the current community development of maternal and child health care in at risk population and the management of pelvic problems resulting from childbirth.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to synthesize the experience and knowledge of these areas and develop in-depth understanding of their own profession.

courses.subject: OBSC
courses.title: Grief experience in pregnancy
courses.description: The course is to enhance the competencies of students in counseling role.It includes:1. Biology of pregnancy loss (miscarriage, induced abortion, ectopic pregnancy, stillbirth)2. Psychopathology on grief process3. Theories of grieving process, influencing factors and appropriate interventions4. Physical and psychological impact to women after hysterectomy5. Impact of maternal death to a family and intervention6. Clinical applications and ethical perspectives on grieving counselling7. Signs and symptoms of burnout and midwife’s self care8. Improve skill in working with families during the crisisAssessment : Written examination
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Obstetric Care
courses.learning_outcomes:
The students are expected to be able to:
1. understand the process of bereavement
2. understand basic interview skills
3. apply basic core skills in a therapeutic way
4. improve skill in working with families during the crisis
